s.text: After spinning to dryness in a clinical centrifuge equipped with plate carriers (Beckman), the arrays were scanned in an Axon Laboratories (Palo Alto, CA) scanner using 532 nm and 635 nm lasers.
The dashed lines represent the log 10 of the true ratios of the antigen concentrations in the two mixes.
Antibodies and antigens that were provided in glycerol solutions were transferred to a glycerol-free, phosphate-buffered saline (PBS) solution (137 mM NaCl, 2.7 mM KCl, 4.3 mM Na
They were transferred immediately to a 3% non-fat milk/PBS/0.

The need for technologies that allow highly parallel quantitation of specific proteins in a rapid, low-cost and low-sample-volume format has become increasingly apparent with the growing recognition of the importance of global approaches to molecular characterization of physiology, development, and disease [ 1, 2].

We therefore investigated the effect of protein background on quantitation, by adding varying concentrations of fetal calf serum (FCS) to the set of six antigen mixes, increasing the overall protein concentrations by 10-fold and 100-fold before labeling and detection (Figure 6).
The six antibody mixes were added to either a 10-fold or a 100-fold excess (by total protein mass) of FCS.
